instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A,<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> sometimes 3v sometimes 8.53v,<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> rail not present
threads.message:
Merry Christmas to all

i have a unit of <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A,magsafe light is on,<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> usually get 3.++v only,but sometimes after plug in the charger for long time or try to plug out and plug in charger for several times,can get 8.54v

here the measurement that i get when the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.54v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.53v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> - 8.53v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> - 8.54v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> - 16.58V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 16.06v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.43v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.321v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5.00v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> - 0.00v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.00v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.321v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 1.6mv
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 3.321v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - 58.6mv
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - 56.5mv
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> - 35.7mv
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - 3.4V

so far have done nothing to the board yet.board all clean,no corrosion at all.look new.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A,<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> sometimes 3v sometimes 8.53v,<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> rail not present
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A,<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> sometimes 3v sometimes 8.53v,<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> rail not present
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A,<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> sometimes 3v sometimes 8.53v,<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> rail not present
threads.message: That seems fine. Does it power on with a charged battery? Check all power rails for shorts to GND, starting with PPBUS of course.
